Package com.milk.asynch

Interface Summary
Filter A Filter is a simple interface for taking a single object and filtering it into some other object.
Receiver This interface is for receiving messages from a logical process (threads and whatnot).
Rendezvous A Rendezvous is anything which combines both a Sender and a Receiver.
Sender This interface is for sending messages to a logical process (threads and whatnot).
SendSource This is the interface which all classes which are the source of calls to Sender.send() should adhere to.
 

Class Summary
CharArrayToStringFilter This class is a filter which merely takes char[]s sent to it and resends them as Strings.
FifoQueue This class implements a FIFO queue for delivery of messages between logical processes.
IdleFilter This class provides a way to sense that a sender has gone idle and send out an idle message.
JustReceiver This is an implementation of Receiver that wraps around another Receiver, and only re-exports the Receiver interface.
JustSender This is an implementation of Sender that wraps around another Sender, and only re-exports the Sender interface.
LineFilter A LineFilter is a resending filter which expects to be fed a bunch of char[]s, interspersed with other arbitrary objects.
MailBox This class implements a simple mailbox system for delivery of a single message between logical processes (i.e., threads or whatnot).
ReaderSender A ReaderSender merely takes a Reader and makes a thread to send hunks of data, as char[]s, to its designated sender.
Resender A Resender is a terminus for sending which can be told to resend to any number (0 included) of other Senders.
SendFilter A SendFilter merely combines SendSource and Sender.
TimedSend TimedSend is the way to get sends to happen based on the passage of time.
 

Exception Summary
SenderCutException This is the exception which is thrown when something tries to cause a send to happen but the target Sender has been told not to send anymore.
